inn1.comm: Zaheer starts off like how he did in the 2003 World Cup final! Wide down the leg side. Pressure!
Gets this one right. Unlike in the 2003. In the temptation zone, just outside off stump, Tharanga leans forward, covers the off stump, and lets it go through to Dhoni
And again.
Tharanga gets off the mark with a square-drive down to the third man region.
Ah. Another one down the leg side. Jayasuriya turns back quickly to see whether Dhoni has got that one. He has.
Again swinging down the leg side. Clips the pad and rolls to the fine-leg region.
Movement is there but it is starting off from the wrong areas. Starts from middle, goes down legside, brushes the pad and another leg-bye
And again. This one proves expensive though. Runs off the pad and to the fine-leg boundary. 10 runs came in the first over. In 2003, Zaheer yielded 15 runs in the first over.

Huge shout for lbw. Agarkar jumps up and down like energiser bunny. The slips are in the air, so is the cover fielder. Full, landed on the middle and leg stump line, swung in, Jayasuriya is caught at the crease, has a waft across the line and is rapped on the pad. To the naked eye, it looked like it was going down the leg side, but hawk eye suggests it would have hit leg stump. Anyways...
Another shout but bit of wood this time. Jayasuriya stabs at a length-delivery on the middle and off stump line and gets a inside-edge on to the pad
jaffa! In the temptation zone, just outside off, Jayasuriya flirts and it's almost fatal. Just kisses past the outside edge. This has been some start from Agarkar.
leans forward, pushes a fullish delivery to cover
full and swinging down the leg side, Jayasuriya tries to to flick, misses and it runs off the pad. Another leg bye.
Full, outside off and Tharanga drives it to cover but Uthappa intercepts it smartly. Good probing over from Agarkar. Complete contrast to Zaheer's first over.

Zaheer starts off this over with a beauty. Landed outside off stump, on a length, and bent back in, Jayasuriya leant forward and shouldered arms. The ball kept curving in and nearly went over the off stump
Fuller, just outside off stump, Jayasuriya is quick to lean forward, opens the bat-face, runs it down to third man region
full, straight, on the middle stump line but that's enough for Tharanga who stretches forward, whips it through midwicket
Takes this one away. Landed outside off and moved away, left alone
probing delivery in the corridor, Tharanga jabs at it, bat away from the body, gets a outside-edge that takes the ball, past the second slip and down to third man region
Another teasing delivery. Agarkar is looking good. Landed on the middle stump line and shaped away from Tharanga who is squared-up a touch, the ball runs of the outer edge through gully
The surprise bouncer arrives. Jayasuriya ducks under.  Over the leg and middle stump line.

leans forward, pushes a length-delivery on the off stump towards mid-off and sets  off. Agarkar rushes across, has to run around Tharanga, picks the ball and flicks it back at non-striker's end without turning. Doesn't hit and anyways Jayasuriya was in.
In the channel that a batsman doesn't like, Tharanga shapes to poke but withdraws. Good cricket all round.
keeps changing things. This one is fuller, on the off and middle stump line and it curves back in. Tharanga arrests his front foot movement, pushes it out to the leg side.

beaten. The variations keep coming. This one leaves the batsman and he has a lame poke at it. Agarkar is buzzing, Zaheer is slowly finding his rhythm, wonder when Jayasuriya will start showing his fantastic skill. This is going to be a humdinger
drifting on to the pads, Jayasuriya fails to make use of it - would have usually whipped it past square-leg - and the ball thuds in to the pad
pitches on a length, outside off stump and straightens. Good delivery. Jayasuriya, however, is aware of the movement, just leans across and shoulders arms
First real drive from Jayasuriya. Not much timing. Fullish, outside off and he drives  to left of Harbhajan at mid-off who makes a diving stop.
length-delivery on the off stump line, coming in with the angle, Jayasuriya shuffles across and defends to midwicket. Cat and mouse game continues.
beaten. Lands on a length, outside off and cuts back in. Tharanga is doubled up as he pushes outside the line - anticipating the ball would either straighten or move away and is beaten.
Will retain the strike with a good old dab to third man
Screaming Agarkar. Calm Harper. Another shout for lbw. Landed on the leg stump line, moved down and Tharanga is struck on the pad while trying to defend. Turned down.

Jayasuriya, finally, gets one down to his favourite long-leg region. Not in his typical aerial way but along the ground. It was fullish, on the middle and leg stump line, Jayasuriya moves into the line and flicked it past square-leg

full, straight, on the off stump line, Tharanga eases forward, head over the ball and defends. Caution is the Sri Lankan mantra so far. The ball is moving around a touch and they don't want to lost a wicket

ooh... just past Sehwag at second slip. This is the first four of the innings. In the channel outside off and moving away, Tharanga pushes at it, with an open-face of the bat, gets an outside edge and it flies past Sehwag.
Thwack! First meaty blow of the day. Full, wide and Tharanga smokes it, in the air, over cover.
closer to the off stump as Agarkar tightens the line, pushed to point

Huge shout for lbw. Zaheer was screaming in hope and then in agony. Oh so close. Landed just outside off stump, cut back in and Jayasuriya is beaten by the pace and the movement ; pushes at it. The ball evades the bat and thuds into the pad in front of middle stump line. Aleem Dar suggests it was going down leg side. Hmm... there was no inside-edge. Hawkeye says it would have taken out middle. Drama continues. Tension ripping through the players.
Zaheer responds to that with a bouncer, Jayasuriya shapes to pull and doesn't get a touch
full, on the off stump line, Jayasuriya is again beaten by the nip-backer and gets a inside-edge on to the pad. That saves him. Zaheer is homing in here.
Length-delivery on the stumps, Jayasuriya goes back to defend

Huge wicket. A nervous-looking Jayasuriya falls. Just how he went in the 1996 semi-final. Caught at wide third man. Prasad was the fielder then, Agarkar is the man now. Full and outside off and the Matara blaster couldn't resist a flash. He freed his arms, got a top-edge that went swirling to Agarkar at squarish third man,  who held it. One down and what a big wicket.

Another Agarkar shout. Going down leg side. Full, on the middle stump line, Jayawardene pushes his bat, way in front of the body, and the ball cuts in and thuds into the pad. It's all happening out there. Where is Bill Lawry?!
full, straight, on the middle stump line, Tharanga shuffles across, gets behind the line, turns it to square-leg
Full and swinging down the leg side, Tharanga can't reach it, Dhoni can and a wide is called.
swing and a miss. Way outside off stump, full and tempting, Tharanga thrusts his front foot out and has a swing. No luck. Thin air. Almost a wide.
on the middle and leg, nicely clipped away past square-leg
Full and outside off, left alone.
full-pitched on the middle stump line, coming in with the angle, driven through the line, towards mid-on where Dravid rushes across to his right to make a diving stop

beaten. Full and swinging away, Mahela, again, just fishes at it. A loose drive, with out moving his front foot and is beaten all hands up. He has to move that front foot, close to the line but that's how he plays when is new at the crease.
Further away from off and left alone

Beauty. Jaffa. Landed on the middle stump line, on a length and sucking Mahela into a loose drive before it left him. To be fair to Mahela, he had to play at it but again he ends up playing a touch too early. The bat is pushed way in front of the body.
well outside off stump, Jayawardene is not interested and a wide is called
Outside off, angling away, left alone
Zaheer continues to test Mahela in that zone. Resists the urge again. Good over.
on the stumps, on a length, pushed to the leg side
Full and outside off stump, left alone
almost driven straight to Agarkar at mid-off. Full in length, around off stump line and Jayawardene drives, in the air, but it falls just short of Agarkar
leans forward and nudges a length-delivery to third man
Beaten outside off stump. Strangling line just outside off and Tharanga pushes at  it, inside the line.
almost edged to Sehwag at second slip. Another length-delivery, just outside off stump, Tharanga shapes to cut and gets a edge. Flies past the second slip.
on the off stump line, pushed to point
length-delivery on the off stump line, pushed to cover point
Mahela breaks free. Mahela charges and drives inside-out over cover. Zaheer saw him coming and pushed it wide but Mahela was good enough to adjust, reach out and drive it over the off side region

Zaheer's agony continues. Another one that teases the outside edge. Landed on a length, around off stump and shapes away, Jayawardene pushes at it, again the bat is away from the body and he is beaten.
wide down the leg side. He wanted to bring it back in but lost control at the release. The left shoulder came through in a an angle and it went down
tip and run. Pushed to the off side and they rush across for a quick single
In the corridor outside off, Mahela shapes to play but withdraws at the last minute. Wise decision.
on the off stump line, Mahela moves towards the line, opens the bat-face, guides it to cover point

shout for lbw but it was going down leg side. Full in length, on the leg stump line and moving down a touch, Tharanga thrusted his front foot across, then withdraws it and tries to tickle the ball to leg side but fails.
Similar delivery but wood meets leather and the ball heads to square-eg

Huge shout for a catch behind. Length-delivery that shaped away from Tharanga who has a nervous push at it. Replays are inconclusive. The ball, it appears, has just gone past the outside edge. Drama continues at Trinidad.
will pinch a single with dab to midwicket.
Lovely slower one. Teasing, tempting and it's in the right zone: Outside off stump. Tharanga was nearly decieved. Shapes to drive but pulls out from the stroke.
Lands on the middle stump line, faster, and it bends back in to thud into Tharanga's pad.
Agarkar takes this one away - round-armish action, the seam pointing towards the slips - and it moves away from the off stump line, pushed to cover point

What an acrobatic effort from Dhoni. Is it his best ever? Fullish, down the legside - didn't deserve a wicket, try telling that to Agarkar, and Mahela flicked it. But it doesn't go off the meat of the bat as the bat-handle rotates and the bat-face shuts and it flies to left of Dhoni who goes airbourne, parallel to the ground and takes it with both hands. Stunning effort and Sri Lanka are under pressure. Two down now.
A run out chance missed. Sanga goes back, pushes a length-delivery to right of Uthappa at cover who swoops on to it and has a shy at the non-striker's end. Had it hit, he would have been a goner.
The crowd are getting into this. There is a definite buzz. Munaf runs in, hurls one in the channel outside off, Sangakkara lets that one go through to Dhoni
on the off stump line, pushed to cover
another length-delivery, on the off and middle stump line, Sangakkara gets behind the line, works it to midwicket.
129.7 kmph delivery slanting away from Sangakkara who covers the off stump line and shoulders arms.
full, straight, on the leg and middle stump line, Sangakkara is cautious, just turns it to midwicket. In other days, he would have gone more squarish.
Fab shot. That was smoked. Half-volley outside off and Sangakkara goes on a bent knee and proposes. Er ... disposes it through the covers. Eye-catching stroke. Sri Lanka need him to score today.
down the leg side, Tharanga is desperate to get a touch, misses and Dhoni gathers.

full, wide - bit of rubbish and Tharanga cuts it down to wide third man. Again the effort was to push it across but the action went more rounder than he intended, the right shoulder fell a bit early in the action
length-delivery on the off stump, pushed to cover
slower one, 110.1 kmph, delivered as a offbreak, on the middle and leg stump line, Sangakkara spots it and defends.

rushes through the channel outside off, Sangakkara shuffles across and leaves it safely to Dhoni. Camera pans to Sri Lankan dressing room. Moody is seen masaging his neck. Hmm... Tension....  Can I get a masseur please.
On the off stump line, goes on straight, pushed to cover.

just short of a driving length, outside the off stump, just too much width on that ball and Thjaranga has no trouble walking across his stumps and carting that one through cover for a boundary. Not the place to bowl to tharanga
back of a length and on the off, once again Tharanga gets nicely behind the line of the ball and punches, but this time it is straight to the man at mid off
short of a length and outside the off stump, this one slants away from the bat and is left well alone to the keeper
a bit too full and a touch straight too, Tharanga hits this one with a straight bat back past the bowler, it won't go all the way, Dinesh Karthik gives chase and fields
short of a length and outside the off stump, left well alone to the keeper

just back of a driving length and a touch outside the off stump, this one is too close for the cut but Tharanga plays the shot anyway, the ball goes off a thick inside edge and just misses the stumps. Dhoni dives well to his left and fields that. Could easily have run away to the fence

fullish and on the off, this one swings in late, good shape from Agarkar here and Tharanga is drawn into the shot, thick inside edge and the ball runs away towards square-leg and the batsmen can pick up a single
full and very straight, Agarkar is on the ball here, defended away watchfully with a bit of a turn of the wrists, no chance of a run
just short of a good length and outside the off, this one is the ball that slants away from the left-handed batsman, punched well but not past the man at cover
short of a good length and outside the off, punched well towards the off side, Harbhajan dives and half stops the ball but somehow lets it go through and the batsmen can pinch a single
short one banged in for a change, good variation from Agarkar. Tharanga watches the ball carefully and ducks under it. The ball carries through nicely to Dhoni behind the stumps
short of a length and outside the off, played away with an angled bat, that was a touch slower, probably the off-cutter
just short of a good length and outside the off, probing line and length, played at and missed, through to the keeper
another one back of a length and outside the off, this time it is left well alone to the keeper

short of a length and outside the off once more, Munaf consistently bowling a good line and length, again Tharanga cuts and again it's the thick inside edge. The ball goes past the stumps and Dhoni dives and fields
short of a length and outside the off, this one slants away from the bat, Tharanga feels for it and misses, through to the keeper
short of a length and a bit too straight, this one is drifting down the leg side, played at and missed, off the pad to the on side for a leg bye

full and outside the off, left well alone to the keeper. End of a really good over from Munaf. He's been nagging away outside the off stump and it's probably only a matter of time before Tharanga takes the bait
flat, fairly quick, on the middle and leg, a bit of turn, defended away to the on side
tossed up just a touch more, on the stumps, just a hint of turn, defended watchfully back down the pitch
a bit full and on the pads, clipped away just wide of mid-on for a single
fuller, flatter, pushed through a bit quicker through the air, not much turn at all there, defended back down the pitch with a straight bat
Shot! Tharanga goes for it and gets away with it. He comes down the pitch and thumps that one over mid-on. Agarkar jumps up but can't get a hand to that
back of a length and on the pads, worked away to the leg side
short of a good length and outside the off, driven on the up but all along the ground - Sangakkara does that really well, getting nicely on top of the ball - straight to cover, though
and again! Munaf beats the outside edge with one outside the off and a touch short of a driving length, Sangakkara plays a forcing shot and misses
this one is dragged down shorter and a bit wider too, Sangakkara's eyes light up and he goes hard at the cut shot but makes no contact
better ball, this one pitches just outside the off and comes in a touch, left caretully alone to the keeper
short of a length and outside the off stump, this one angles away a bit and is watched carefully and left alone
short of a length and outside the off, played down to the off side with soft hands. The batsmen pinch a single to end the over
tossed up and outside the off, teasing flight there, eased away through cover towards long-off where Sourav Ganguly fields as the batsmen get two
tossed up once again and outside the off, Harbhajan comes round the stumps, chopped away through point for a single
short of a length and down the leg side, this one spins a bit, worked away to the leg side
tossed up and outside the off stump, defended carefully. Harbhajan has reverted to over the stumps and fairly flat stuff
fullish and on the off, driven to cover
short of a length and just outside the off, Tharanga stands tall and chops that hard past Yuvraj Singh at point. No chance for the fielder in the deep and that's not a good start from Ganguly
short of a good length and on the stumps, defended watchfully
floater just outside the off, the batsman is drawn into the stroke and misses, through to the keeper
on the pads and quite full, tucked away through square-leg
full and just outside the off, driven nicely but straight to the fielder at cover
down the leg side, flick played and missed, wide called. This is a bit of an untidy start from Sourav Ganguly.
fullish and on the stumps, defended away to the on side with an angled bat
tossed up and on the pads, a touch of spin, defended to the off side with bat and pad held close together
flat and on the stumps, played at and missed, rapped on the pad, appeal for lbw but that pitched outside leg
eased to long-off for a couple
flat and outside the off, angling away from the left-handed batsman, eased past point for a single
flat and on the stumps, defended to the leg side
eased to cover to end the over
full and on the stumps, driven to cover
short of a good length and on the pads, clipped away to the on side

Ganguly gets the breakthrough! Inspired captaincy to bring Ganguly into the attack? Sangakkara goes after one that is pitched just short of a driving length and tries to whack it over long-on. The timing is good but perhaps too good, the ball floats across and seems to hang in the air for a fair bit before Munaf Patel runs a few yards to his right and takes a good catch
fullish and outside the off stump, just a hint of away movement, left alone to the keeper
fuller and on the off stump, Chamara Silva punches this nicely to long-off to get off the mark
full and outside the off stump, left alone to the keeper, end of a successful over from Ganguly
well flighted and outside the off, a hint of turn, easily played through point for a single
tossed up and outside the off, eased away past the infield towards long-off
flat and on the off stump, restrictive but not particularly threatening, Chamara Silva walks across his stumps and flicks to on
tossed up, given a rip, that one takes off from nowhere! past the edge. There is a bit of assistance for the spinner if you're willing to toss the ball up a bit and give it a rip
fuller and outside the off, this is the one that goes straight on. Played and missed, through to the keeper
fullish and outside the off, Tharanga slashes and slashes hard, the ball beats point and races towards the fence. Dinesh Karthik dives full length and gets a hand to the ball but cannot stop it.
fuller and a touch too straight, clipped off the pads to the on side for a single
too full and a touch too straightt, easily stroked away through midwicket for a single
fullish and outside the off stump, driven at, thick edge goes down to third-man
fullish and outside the off, worked away just wide of cover for a single
full and on the stumps, clipped to the on side
fullish and outside the off stump, Tharanga shoulders arms and leaves that one well alone to the keeper
fulliish and outside the off, Tharanga strokes that well through cover. Ganguly has to run around a fair bit and dive to save that one but he does so
short of a length and outside the off stump, chopped hard down past the man at slip for a single
short of a good length and on the pads, played down to the on side.
short of a good length and outside the off, Tharanga drops the ball to his feet and takes a single
eased away through point for a single to end the over
full and outside the off, eased to cover with an angled bat
full and on the off, played down towards mid-off. The batsmen hare off for a single. Harbhajan fields and throws but can't score a direct hit
full and outside the off, Chamara Silva opens the face of the bat a touch and knocks the ball away towards cover

full, outside the off, Silva is tempted into driving and can only manage a thick edge. There's no-one at slip and the ball bounds down towards the third-man fence. Zaheer Khan dives and gets a hand to it but can't hold onto the ball
overpitched and on the stumps, punched to cover
floated a bit wider and pushed through a bit full, left well alone to the keeper
short off a good length and on the off, punched off the back foot towards point
short of a length and outside the off, chopped hard but down to point
another one tucked away into the gap for an easy single
great ball! this one pitches just outside the off and shapes away really late. A bit of extra bounce as well. Played and missed, lucky not to edge, through to the keeper
very full and on the stumps, defended back down the pitch
another good ball, on the off, coming in a touch, defended with bat held close to pad, end of a tidy over from Munaf
far down the leg side, easily left alone, wide called
tossed up a touch more and on the stumps, spinning a touch, eased to cover for a single
flat and on the off, it's the doosra, defended watchfully to the off side with a straight bat
down the leg side, tickled away fine for a couple, Robin Uthappa fields
flat and fast, on the off, defended
tossed up and on the stumps, swept hard, Munaf runs around on the boundary and fields
seam-up, full and drifting down leg side, hint of swing and a wide is called
leans forward to a delivery on the middle and off stump and pushes it out to cover. Camera pans to few girls in the crowd. Sacheeen Sacheeen they scream!
bit of drift in, full and on the middle stump line, defended back down the track
lovely swing away. Seam-up, it went towards off stump before shaping further away and Silva is beaten in the forward prod
And again. It is curving away nicely for Tendulkar. He is bowling seam-up stuff, not legbreaks.
lands on the off stump line, moved away a touch, pushed to cover
on the off stump line, turns away a touch, pushed to backward point
floated up on the middle stump line, slightly short in length, paddled away behind square-leg
nicely flighted on the off stump line, turns in, Silva works it to Tendulkar at short fine leg and rushes across for a quick single. Tendulkar has a shy at non-striker's end but Silva makes it
leans forward to smother the spin

flighted delivery outsisde legstump and nicely tickled away fine. Tendulkar sets off after it, picks it up near the ropes and fires in an throw. They run only two, should  have had three easily. Hmm....
again on the middle and leg stump line and swept away to long leg for a single. 250 should be a good score on this track. This match is going to be maha interesting
drifting to the leg side ,short in length, attempts to pull and it brushes the pad and Dhoni gathers

Tendulkar takes out the well-set Tharanga. Full in length, lands on the middle stump line and shapes down. Tharanga is walking all over the crease and tries to dab it to the on side, fails and is hit in front of leg and middle. Would have hit leg.  Tendulkar is getting some movement there. In the previous over, it was in the air and now, it is off the track.
Slightly short in length and outside off stump, cut away to point where Yuvraj mis-fields and yields a single
leg-cutter that moved away from the off stump line and Silva waits for the movement, opens the bat-face and runs it down to third man region. Well bowled and very well played.
again a touch short to Dilshan and he cuts it to deep point

produces the mistake but the edge takes the ball down to third man. After moving off the pitch earlier in the over, he makes this one swing in the air. Full and swinging and Silva is sucked into a loose drive.
tossed-up, outside off stump, turns in and defended on the front foot
lands outside off stump and spins down leg side. Muralitharan must be licking his fingers. Wide called.
Again some sharp albeit slow turn. Silva backs away and cuts a delivery from the middle stump line, through cover. Silva is a fine batsman. Saw his century in New Zealand? Fine stroke player.
well flighted, above the eye-level, on the middle stump line, Dilshan waits for the dip, drives to long off
tossed-up, outside off and Silva sweeps it to deep backward square-leg
doosra on the off stump line, slightly short in length and cut to sweeper cover
from close to the stumps, Tendulkar hurls one full and swinging on the middle stump line, pushed to cover
slightly slower, on the off stump line, nudged close on the off side, towards cover point, for a single
appeal for lbw but it was swinging outside off stump. Full-pitched and outside off, Silva tries to sweep and misses.
full, straight, on the middle stump line, keeps a touch low, Silva drops it close on the off side and they take a very quick single.
short in length, outside off stump and Dilshan pulls it - doesn't time it well, to deep midwicket
some in-swing there. But starts too early in the trajectory and lands slightly short in length and the batsman gets good time to see it and jabs it away to the off side
full and wide outside off stump, has a flash but can't reach it.
Short in length, outside off stump, and Dilshan leaps at it and cuts it past backward point. He will keep playing his strokes. Always attractive to watch.
goes for a yorker but it swings outside the off stump, Dilshan tries to jab it away but misses.
length-delivery, around the off stump, Dilshan goes back, punches it to the off side, wants a run but is sent back.
short in length and slanting away from Dilshan who adjusts nicely to the length, opens the bat-face and dabs it down to third man

lemon cut! Full in length and in the channel, Silva lunges at it to defend, the bat comes down in an angle and he gets an inside-edge which takes the ball past the stumps and to the fine-leg boundary.
full in length, outside the off stump and Dilshan punches it through the line, to long-off
full, straight, on the middle stump line, dabbed to square-leg and Dhoni sets off in pursuit. Even produces a sliding stop.
beaten. Whenever he has bowled it full, he has got swing. Full and it curves away from off stump and Dilshan is beaten while trying to drive.
full and outside off, Dilshan drives, loosely, bat away from the body and gets a single past point.
leg cutter, around the off stump, Dilshan tries to punch it through the line but is a touch early into the stroke and gets a inside-edge which takes the ball down the track.
Another lemon-cut. Length-delivery, around the off stump, Silva pushes hard at it, bat away from the body, and gets the inside-edge down to fine leg
on the middle and off stump, nudged to behind square-leg for a single
short in length and outside off, cut past point
hits the deck short of length, it rises almost chest-high, outside off stump, Silva hops back, pushes his bat out at the delivery,  dabs it on the off side and they will take the single
another quick single. This is intelligent cricket. Length-delivery on the off and middle stump line, pushed to the off side and by the time Zaheer gets across they have made the dash.
from round the wickets, short in length, angling in at the body, Silva takes the bottom-hand out of the handle, stabs at it and will get a single as it runs behind square-leg
on a length,, hint of movement in the air, outside off and Silva leans back, dabs it to point
full and swinging away, and Silva sweeps it from there, to deep square-leg.
around off stump, slightly short in length, Dilshan knives it through the line, down to Uthappa at long on. Sensible cricket. Keep getting the singles. 39 off 36 balls.
beaten trying to run down a fullish delivery to third man
in swing this time. This man can bowl everything. The swing starts a touch early in the trajectory though and the batsman sees it and defends
bit of width outside off stump and driven to sweeper cover
on the middle stump, it turns down and Silva goes back, turns it to square-leg for yet another single.
lands outside off stump, on a length and straightens, Dilshan backs away and cuts it to deep point

appeal for lbw. Fullish, lands on the middle stump line and turns, Silva attempts to sweep and is rapped on the pads. It appeared as if it would have hit leg but umpire Harper  felt it would have spun down leg side.
another nudge, another single, this time to behind square-leg
on the middle stump line, driven to long on
on the middle stump line, driven back to the bowler
slightly short, outside off, cut to Yuvraj at point
fullish, on the off stump line, Dilshan goes down on his knee and laps it around the corner. Very nicely paddled away.

Wow! Suddenly, against the run of play, he charges down the track, the ball was swinging away but he has it covered and swings it to widish long on to bring up the fifty partnership. Very well played gentlemen and Sri Lanka inch towards a very competitive total
full and outside off, another attempt to sweep but doesn't make contact and is rapped on the pad.
faster and flatter, on the off stump line, turns in , Dilshan tries to turn it to leg side, gets an inside-edge and it rolls over to the leg side
fullish, swept away to Agarkar at deep midwicket

reverse sweep attempted. No wood on leather though. It spins down the leg side and Dhoni fails to gather. Silva's back foot was on the line as he went for the sweep. Could have been interesting had Dhoni gathered but one suspects that Silva would have dragged it back in time
fuller and on the middle stump line, driven back to the bowler
leans forward, pushes a fullish delivery past point
fuller, on the middle and leg stump line, driven to long-on
low full-toss on the off stump, Silva paddles it to short fine leg where Munaf makes a half-stop
gentle seam-up, on the middle stump line, driven to long-on
slower one and he deceives the batsman. Silva is too early into his offdrive and gets a outside edge through backward point
in-swinger to Silva who goes back and square-drives it to deep cover
He will get his third consecutive fifty in this World Cup and his fourth ODI fifty in a row. Reaches it with a drive to long-on. Very well played sir. What a find he has been for Sri Lanka
Tossed-up , outside off, Silva is beaten in the flight but gets a edge through the vacant slip region.
shapes to reverse-sweep and Harbhajan fires it down the leg side. Wide called.
will get a single with a nudge to square-leg
200 comes up with a drive to long-on. Dilshan charges out, Harbhajan fires it in the blockhole and is jabbed away
outside off stump and square-drive to deep cover
way outside the off stump. Aleem Dar extends his arms.
inswinger. Full in length, on the middle stump line - that one came in from well outside off. driven to Dravid at midwicket
takes this one away and slashed down to third man. Tendulkar screams catch but it falls well short
Super strike by Dilshan. Full and on the off and middle stump line, Dilshan takes out his left leg from the line and swings it over midwicket. The big strokes are coming out now.
outside off stump and driven to sweeper cover
Full and on the middle and leg, Silva sweeps it fine. Very fine. Past the short-fine leg fielder. 11 runs have come so far in the over. Very profitable for Sri Lanka.
Silva gets greedy. He goes for another sweep shot to a delivery outside off but misses
fullish, on the off stump line, Dilshan, again, takes out the left leg outside the line and whacks it straight to Dravid at cover.
Fab stroke. Low full-toss on the off and middle stump line, Dilshan goes inside-out, through extra cover. Very well placed.
full-pitched, outside off stump, Dilshan goes for a square-drive but makes no contact. Dhoni and Munaf appeal, no edge though.

produces the nick this time. Dilshan's lovely cameo comes to an end. Length-delivery outside off stump and Dilshan tries to drill it on the up but ends up nicking to Dhoni. Sri Lanka are on 216 for 5.
hits the deck short of length, on the off stump line, punched to left of Yuvraj who makes a diving stop. Arnold is down the track, halts after the Yuvraj dive and retreats
Similar delivery, similar stroke and similar result.

now Silva falls. Just like Dilshan did, he also walks without waiting for the umpire's call. Zaheer gets him with a slower one. An off cutter. Full and outside off and Silva is through with his off drive a touch too early.  Gets a nick which is swallowed by Dhoni. Two new batsmen at the crease.
Another edge but no slip and it flies through for a boundary. Full in length, on the off and middle stump line and it shapes away. Vaas has a push at it and gets the edge. Now the slip moves in.
homing in on the off stump, pushed to cover region.
yorker, ends up as a low full-toss on the off and middle stump line, driven to mid-off
another edge but this time to  third man. It was a touch wider and Vaas has a flash and ends up running it down to Agarkar.
short in length, around off stump, Arnold stands up tall, works it to square-leg for a single. Three overs left.
around the off stump line, full in length, driven back to the bowler
Whack! half-volley outside off stump and drilled through extra cover. Arnold is the finisher for Sri Lanka and he is chipping in today.
leans forward, drives to deep cover
Boom! Vaas goes down town. Full-pitched on the off stump and he simply knifed through the line. Up ... up and over long-off.
Another attempted lofted shot, the bat-handle rotates a touch and he ends up slicing it to left of Dravid at long-off.

Goes for a slower one but Arnold spots it, reaches out to the fullish delivery outside off and smokes it through extra cover. The floodgates have opened. 26 runs have come in the last three overs as Sri Lanka charge towards a 250+ score.
Fullish on the middle and leg stump line, driven to mid-on
attempted yorker turns into low full-toss on the middle stump line, Arnold shuffles across, works it past square-leg
banged in short, it climbs shoulder-high outside off stump, Vaas adjusts, pulls but doesn't get much behind it and it rolls over to mid-on and he rushes across for a single
on the middle and leg, nicely clipped away behind square and very well placed. He will come back for two. Didn't hit that hard, just placed it behind square.
yorker on the off stump line, shapes in the air, dabbed to midwicket for a single
he goes for another yorker, almost at the blochole, on the middle stump line, stabbed away and Zaheer dives to his right to make the stop. Final over coming up.
gift-wraps a four. Full and down the leg side, flicked away past short fine leg. Now the fine leg goes back, long-off comes inside the circle.
low full toss , on the legs, flicked away to Ganguly at deep square-leg. Arnold would feel he missed an opportunity there.
another low full-toss, Vaas has one almighty swing across the line, gets an inside-edge and to Dhoni. Lucky escape for Agarkar.
Oh ho! another full-toss and Vaas makes no mistake this time. Drills it over midwicket. Sri Lanka cross 250. Very competitive score.
Deja-vu. Almost. It was another low full toss and sliced away to the right of long-on.

Agarkar had enough of trying for yorkers and slipping in low full-tosses. Bangs this one in short, rises shoulder-high, on the off stump line. Arnold shapes to pull but is beaten by the bounce and the pace.

inn2.comm: full and on the stumps, punched to mid-off to start things off
full and on the stumps again, punched to the off side. Interestingly Kumar Sangakkara has got a helmet and is standing up to Vaas
full and very straight, a bit of movement in to the right-handed Uthappa, driven back to the bowler
just short of a driving length and on the off stump, Uthappa opens the face of the bat and angles the ball to the off side. India still not off the mark after four balls
a touch too straight this time, just drifting down leg with the swing. Uthappa walks across his stumps and flicks well but straight to the fielder at square-leg
again drifting onto the pads and once again Uthappa manages to wristily work the ball away to the on side
fullish and outside the off, Ganguly confidently moves across and glides the ball through point. That brings up Ganguly's 1000th run in World Cup matches
just short of a good length and on the off, Ganguly covers the swing well and defends back down the pitch
just short of a driving length and drifting onto the pads, clipped away to the leg side off the pads
short one banged in just outside the off, Ganguly sees that early and goes for the pull, that's uppish but well over midwicket
just short of a length and very straight, on the stumps, defended back down the pitch with a straight bat
once again just short of a driving length and on the off stump, Ganguly gets behind the line nicely and defends
short of a good length and outside the off, nice shape in for Vaas once more, Uthappa defends watchfully to the off side and he's yet to get off the mark
short of a good length and outside the off, Uthappa opens the face of the bat slightly and pushes to off
short of a good length and outside the off, Uthappa drives well on the up but Dilshan pulls off a really good save at point
fuller and on the stumps, Uthappa gets his front foot well down the pitch and drives hard to mid-off
just short of a length and a bit too much width outside the off. This allows Uthappa to run the ball down to third-man and get off the mark
full and on the pads, worked to the on side with a straight bat, that's the end of the over and Uthappa will now face Malinga for the first time this innings
short of a length and outside the off, Uthappa goes after this one, cracking it away  past cover. The placement is excellent and the timing better ... that one runs away to the boundary
back of a length and outside the off, once again Uthappa pushes to off with an angled bat. This time it is straight to the fielder at cover
just short of a good length and on the stumps, a bit of extra bounce, defended down to the leg side, the batsmen think about a single and wisely decide against it
just short of a driving length and slipping down leg, Uthappa flicks but that's uppish. Lands safely between square-leg and midwicket
short of a good length - that seems to be Malinga's standard length so far - on the stumps, Ganguly pulls awkwardly and misses
just short of a length and outside the off stump, Ganguly fends back down the pitch keeping the bowler interested in the caught and bowled but the ball falls well wide of him

full and on the off, Uthappa plants his foot down the pitch and smears that across the line. The ball goes like a bullet towards mid-on where Muralitharan throws himself forward and tries to pluck the ball out of the air but just can't hold onto it. That was close!
short of a length and outside the off, pushed to point
just short of a good length and on the pff, punched to the off side
overpitched and outside the off stump ... BANG! Uthappa gets across nicely and drives on the up in fine style through cover. That is a gorgeous shot
just short of a length and on the stumps, Vaas back to a good line and length immediately after that blip, Uthappa defends back down the pitch

back of a driving length, on the stumps, Uthappa drives anyway, picking the ball up and lofting it over the bowler's head. No chance for any of the fielders there and Uthappa is well and truly on his way
short of a length and just outside the off stump, defended to the off side with great care and a straight bat
back of a good length and on the stumps, Ganguly bunts the ball to the on side and hares off for a single
well down the leg side, Uthappa shapes to flick but is nowhere near the ball, wide called and rightly so
short of a length and outside the off stump, Uthappa flays it off the front foot with a horizontal bat to mid-off
fullish and outside the off, eased just wide of the man at cover for a single
slower ball on the off, Ganguly is forced to adjust his shot and dab the ball to the leg side
short of a good length and on the off, Ganguly chooses to defend carefully to the off side
short of a good length and outside the off, Uthappa goes for the big heave, the ball clears mid-on but is not timed too well
another smear to the on side, this time the ball goes along the ground but to Murali at mid-on
low full-toss outside the off, Uthappa drives well to cover where the ball is half stopped and sneaks through, the batsmen steal a single
short of a good length and outside the off, the ball shapes away from Ganguly who opens the face of the bat and runs the ball down to third-man

Got him! Short of a good length, on the off, Uthappa crashes that one back down the pitch. It's hit hard but to the left of Chaminda Vaas who moves aside watchfully, keeps his eyes on the ball and pulls off a stunning catch. That is some catch from the crafty left-arm seamer!
Virender Sehwag is the new man in. He watches his first ball, fullish and outside the off, carefully, and leaves it alone to the keeper
short of a good length and outside the off, Ganguly goes back, swivels and pulls, just the single there
short of a good length and on the off stump, Sehwag moves across and defends with the full face of the bat
very full and just outside the off stump, Sehwag watches the ball carefully onto his bat and glides it to third-man by opening the face of the bat late
short one banged in, good pace as well, but that's pitched halfway down the track and easily ducked under by Ganguly
fullish and outside the off, punched just wide of mid-off
full and outside the off, a slower ball, Ganguly is into the shot early and misses, the ball goes through to Sangakkara
just short of a good length and outside the off, played down to gully with an angled bat
short of a good length and outside the off, the ball comes onto the bat nicely and Sehwag carves it through cover in typical fashion. That was well struck!
good-length ball on the stumps, driven to cover with a straight bat
BANG! That ball does not swing, is a touch too full and Sehwag carts it back over the bowler's head. That's another boundary for Sehwag ...

just short of a length, outside the off, shaping back a touch but not enough, Sehwag plays and misses, struck on the pad. Loud, loud shout for the lbw from Vaas which is turned down by Aleem Dar, and rightly so. That would have gone well over the stumps
worked away to the on side
down the leg side, not the best beginning from Fernando, flick played and missed, wide called
short of a good length, 90 miles per hour, does not bounce too much, played at and missed, struck on the leg just above the pad
a touch of width and the ball disappears, Sehwag flashes hard and the ball runs away past the slips cordon to the third-man boundary
short one banged in outside the off, left well alone to the keeper
full and outside the off, driven inside out to cover
very full and on the pads, a hint of late inswing too, Sehwag jams the bat down and gets the ball away to the leg side
Ganguly comes down the pitch to this one and drives, all along the ground but not great power and straight to mid-off
pitches on leg stump, short of a length, flicks it in front of square for a single
on the mark, back of a length and straight. Ganguly gets behind the line and drives it back to the bowler
similar delivery. Vaas doesn't give anything away. Pushed back to the bowler. Ganguly doesn't get the room to free his arms
Vaas is the master of the drip-drip method. He doesn't give any room again. Ganguly can only play it back

Oh! Got 'em. Having been bogged down for a few deliveries, Ganguly tries to break the shackles. He coems down the track and tries to launch it over mid-off. The ball is a canny Vass off-cutter and leaves the batsman. Ganguly can only manage a thick edge and the ball balloons wide of mid-on, where Muralitharan rushes back and stretches full to pull off a beauty. He dropped Uthappa earlier (that was a tough chance) but there was no way he was going to let this go. His team-mates mob him in celebration
Full ball on off, Sehwag drives to the cover fielder
Back of lenth and outside off. Left alone
pitches outside off stump and angles away from Tendulkar who lets it go
pitches on leg stump and slides past, Tendulkar tries to flick but misses, Sangakkara dives to his left and saves

and Tendulkar goes! Could this be his last World Cup innings? The ball pitched outside off stump, nipped back, Tendulkar lunged forward, the ball hit the inside edge of the bat and crashed into leg stump, huge huge wicket for Sri Lanka and India are fading away.
full ball outside off, driven to cover
Speedy again. 144.4kph. Outside off and back of a length. Dravid plays it late and keeps it out to the off side
Banged in. Steepling into Dravid's throat. He jumps up and keeps it out. Down the ground
Full ball. Dart on middle. He's the master Vaas. Sehwag drives through the off side
Stand and deliver. Vaas slightly outside off and Sehwag pushes forward and creams it through the gaps in the cover.  He beats the field and nobody has a chance there. Will this be Sehwag'd day?
Flicked away front of square for a single
patted to the off side for a single
Wide outside off, very unlike the metronomic Vaas. Sehwag gives it the kitchen, sink and all the cutlery but can only get a bottom edge onto wicketkeeper Sangakkara. That should have been put away
Outside off and slightly fullish. Whipped away wide of mid-on for a quick single. Sehwag scampering between the wickets. They'll need more of that if they want to stay in this tournament
Speedy and full. Driven straight to mid-off
fullish and outside the off, a bit pacy too, flashed at and missed, through to the keeper
full and slipping down the leg side, Sehwag walks across and dabs the ball delicately to fine-leg
fuller and outside the off, a bit of extra bounce, through to the keeper as Dravid leaves the ball well alone
too full, too straight, Dravid comes across nicely and flicks delectably through midwicket. That's four all the way
short of a good length, outside the off, good pace on this one too, comes in a touch, Dravid defends carefully down to slip
just short of a good length and on the stumps, whipped away towards midwicket for a brace
HUGE! That's maximum from the blade of Virender Sehwag! Foot planted down the ground, Sehwag lines that up and crashes it back over the bowler's head for a massive six!
pushed towards point with an angled bat
overpitched and on the pads, tucked away towards square-leg with a turn of the wrists
fullish ball on the off, Dravid comes across, covers the swing and the line of the ball and defends with a straight bat
full once more and outside the off stump, eased to cover with a straight bat
a bit of width outside the off, slightly short, carved uppishly down to third-man for a single
short of a good length, on the off, a bit of extra bounce, Dravid has to get on tip-toe and defends that one back down
yorker speared in, it's well on target, Dravid manages to get his feet out of the way and dig the ball out
very full and on the stumps, defended away to the on side
another one that's slightly short of a length and rears up awkwardly, Dravid looks to defend to the on side but misses and takes the ball on his body
short of a length and outside the off, Dravid once again stands tall and defends, dabbing the ball to the off side
tossed up a touch, on the off, turning in a touch, defended to the leg side
whipped away to the leg side for a single
tossed up and outside the off, big turn in to Dravid who chops the ball away off his stumps
faster ball on the stumps, keeps a bit low, turns a touch, Dravid digs it out
down the leg side, perhaps he was attempting the doosra? swept and missed, wide called
this was definitely the doosra but it was short and wide and sat up, Sehwag rocks back and cuts it beautifully in front of square for a boundary

Dropped! Full and outside the off, Sehwag has a dart at it. Thick outside edge. Kumar Sangakkara throws himself to his right full-length and tries to catch that but the ball pops out. Tremendous effort there from the keeper
defended
defended on the back foot towards point
very full and slipping well down the leg side, Dravid loves it there and sends the ball packing with a minimum of fuss. flicked away beautifully through square-leg for a boundary
short of a good length and on the off, Dravid is solid in defence, moving across his crease and blocking with a straight bat
short of a length and outside the off, pushed away to cover where the ball is easily fielded
overpitched and just on the off stump, Sehwag wristily dismisses that one down to deep backward square-leg, Murali runs around well on the ropes and fields
fullish and on the off stump, Dravid comes fully forward and defends to the off side with bat held close to pad
fullish and outside the off, driven well but can't beat the man at cover-point

just short of a length and outside the off, Dravid inside edges that onto pad and takes off for a single, the fielder at cover charges in and has an underarm throw, misses and the overthrow is possible
full and straight, defended to the leg side
full, straight, quite pacy from Malinga, defended well down the pitch
short of  a length and outside the off, chopped to point
short of a driving length and outside the off, Sehwag opens the face of the bat and runs the ball down to third-man
short of a good length and on the off, Dravid works the ball wristily to the on side and picks up a single
short of a length and outside the off, chopped down to point
whipped away off the hips down to fine-leg, Sehwag handles that short delivery quite well and picks up a single in the process
short of a length once more and again Dravid is content just getting on top of the ball and dabbing it to the leg side for a single
wide down the leg side. Lands outside leg stump, spins away
on the middle and leg stump line, straightens a touch, Dravid is rapped on the pads. hawe eye suggests it would have taken out the leg stump
on the middle and leg, turned to square-leg
from round the stumps comes a lovely doosra. Dravid shapes to cut but it spins too much
tossed up on the middle, Dravid shapes to pull, it balloons up off the pad and goes towards where silly point would be. Sangka charges after it, dives but can't reach it.
low full-toss outside off stump, Sehwag reaches out, whips it across the line, towards long-on
tossed-up, on the leg stump line, driven through the on side
tossed up, on the off stump line, Dravid stretches forward, drives back to the bowler
similar stroke but this time he places it well, out to long-off
slower through the air, well-flighted, Sehwag leans forward, waits for the delivery and square-drives it to backward point
outside off stump line, Sehwag drives past point for a single. Moves to 47.
from round the stumps, on the middle and leg,straightens, Sehwag eases forward, pushes it back down the track
beaten. Full and outside off stump, Sehwag opens the face of the bat and tries to drive square and is beaten
on the off stump line, Sehwag moves in to the line, drives to left of cover and rushes across. Again he doesn't ground the bat, just hops in. Hmm....
on the off stump line, drives to long-off
full and just outside leg stump. Sehwag lets it go and it goes pretty close to the leg stump. Oohs and aahs from Sanga and the bowler

Big wicket. Murali takes out Sehwag and India slip further as Sri Lanka tighten the screws. It was floated outside the off stump, Sehwag leans forward, and opens the bat-face as he tries to drive - he had been beaten earlier in this over, trying to play a similar shot, this time connects and sends it straight to Mahela who swoops low at slip to take the sharp catch. Sri Lanka are climbing all over India. Bangladeshi fans must be whooping in delight.
fullish, on the middle and off, driven to long-on
on the off stump line, turned behind square. Played with the turn there. 100 comes up for India. Slow hand clapping from few fans. They are not in a great mood.
backs away to cut a slightly short of length delivery to deep point
outside off stump, worked straight to midwicket
tossed-up, outside off , Yuvraj drives it down to long-on
on the off stump line, just outside in fact, Dravid leans forward, finds it is not turning, so wrists it across to the on side for a single.
arm-ball on the off stump line, Dravid leans forward and defends.
on the off stump line, pushed to the off side
on the off stump line, driven to long on
outside leg stump line, nudged to towards square-leg
flatter, on the middle stump line, turns in slightly, Dravid stays adjacent to the line, drives to cover
doosra on the middle stump line, Dravid has it covered, bat comes down in an arc to cover for the break away and dabs it to off side
offbreak on the middle stump line , the magician continues to conjure up tricks, Dravid is good enough for it and leans forward to defend
just outside off stump, goes on straight, Yuvraj leans back, cuts it to backward point
floated on the off stump line, pushed back to the bowler
outside off stump, keeps a touch low, Yuvraj cuts it to Vaas at deep point
nicely floated on the middle and leg stump line, Dravid takes out the left leg out of the line and drives inside-out to cover
on the off stump line, Dravid eases forward and defends
outside off stump, full in length, Dravid stretches out, doesn't reach the pitch but drives to the left of mid-off and will retain the strike
beaten by the doosra. Lands on the middle and off stump, Dravid lunges forward and has a stab and the ball moves past the outside edge
slightly short in length, outside off , cut to deep point
on the middle stump line, swept to deep square -leg. Nice fluent swing of the bat.
outside off stump, bit too full and Dravid drives to long-off
doosra outside off stump, Yuvraj lets it go through. There was slip in place waiting for a loose drive but Yuvraj resists.
on the middle and leg stump line, flicked past square-leg

almost done in the flight. On the middle and leg stump line, Yuvraj charges out but arrests the movement as the ball dips, and then, tries to paddle it away but doesn't connect and the ball raps the pad
similar line, this time the lap shot is successful

Tragedy for Yuvraj. Joy for Sri Lanka. Drifting in on the middle and leg stump line, nudged to wards short fine leg. Yuvraj rushes across like a express train - it was his call as it went behind the stumps  but there was no run in it , Dravid sends him back and Yuvraj can't make it. The throw went slightly wide of the stumps - like how Steve Waugh's throw came to Boon who ran out the last man in the 1992 World Cup, and here, Jayasuriya moves to his right, gathers and whips the bails off. Yuvraj was no where in sight. It was his call, all right, but I don't think Dravid would have made it to the other side. The short-fine leg fielder was pretty close and it was Arnold there and he swooped there like a hawk
on the middle stump line, pushed to the on side
floated on the off stump line, turned to the short third man

Dhoni walks for a lbw. It was that plumb. Fab delivery. Landed on the middle stump line and hurried on straight - a stunning toppie, Dhoni had backed to cut and he had no place to hide. Tried to get his bat down in a hurry but the ball rushes on and rams the pad. Dead duck. What a bowler!
on the leg and middle, runs off the pad
outside off stump, slightly short in length, cut down to third man region
on the off stump line, Agarkar pushes at it, gets a outside edge, down to third man region
lands on the middle and leg stump line, turns down and raps him on the pads. Going down.
tossed on the middle stump line, driven to midon
drifting in from outside off - typical Jayasuriya delivery, and nudged behind square-leg
tossed-up, ends up as a low full-toss, weebly pushed back down the track
floated outside off stump, driven to deep cover
arm-ball, on the off and middle, cut to deep point
flighted delivery, driven to long-on
way outside off stump, Dravid reaches out and cuts past point.
on the middle stump line, driven to deep midwicket
similar delivery, similar shot.
doosra, outside the off stump, Dravid reaches out and cuts to deep point
outside the off stump, turns in and pushed to silly point
on the off stump line, full in length, driven to long-off
short outside the off stump, keeps a touch low as it straightens, Dravid backs away to cut through backward point
on the middle stump line, driven to mid-off
floated on the middle stump, driven back to the bowler
drives to long-on for a single.
on the off stump line, comes in with the angle, driven to the bowler
strangling line continues. Jayasuriya continues to bowl his arm-balls at various pace and lengths. This one is slightly  short and is punched back to the bowler
on the off stump line, pushed to short third man
Malinga round-arms a 144.2 kph delivery on the off stump line, driven to cover
full, straight, on the middle stump line, Agarkar gets behind the line, pushes it out to the off side
141.0 kmph, on the off stump line, driven back to the bowler, it bounces over Malinga, and goes to mid-off.
142.9 screamer of a bouncer. Agarkar ducks under and the ball flies over the leg stump line
banged in short, rears up at the body, Agarkar hops up, takes out the bottom-hand out of the handle and fends it away
Another bouncer, again Agarkar ducks.
drifts in from outside off, driven to right of wide long on
charges down the track , reaches the pitch and drives inside-out to deep cover
another arm-ball, slightly short in length, pushed to long on
fuller, outside leg stump line, Dravid jumps down two paces, and drives to long on
slightly short in length, pulled to Vaas at deep midwicket
backs away to the leg side, Hello?! Malinga pushes it outside off and he is beaten. Dravid immediately is down the track to have a chat with Agarkar.
Malinga responds the previous effort with a bouncer.
Another bouncer ,again Agarkar backs away - think he was anticipating that and has a flash but can't reach it

Dravid is in danger of being left stranded. Full in length, on the off stump line Agarkar goes for a risky lofted drive, ends up ballooning it to Arnold at mid-on.. He doesn't make any mistake and India are tottering at 136 for 7.
on the off and middle stump line, guided to third man
dabbed to square-leg for a single.
leans forward and defends.
yet another arm-ball, this one is slightly short, punched to long-off
on the middle and leg stump line, paddled away and hold on... Dravid is cramped up. He hobbles across to the other end. Now he has dropped his bat, and is clutching his right calf muscle
leans forward to defend.
full and just outside off stump, Dravid cuts it late, ala Arjuna Ranatunga. Delectable late cut.
on the off stump line, pushed to cover
Full and well outside off stump, slashed away to third man. It takes a bit of outside edge and runs to the boundary. Dravid is on 49.

brings up his fifty in style.  A fierce flick behind square. Full and on the legs, he leant forward and flicked it in the air. Three fours in this over. Dravid is carrying on the fight and the Indian hopes.
oh ho! Another one. Smashed through backward point. Short and outside off stump, Dravid leans back and cuts it past point.
fullish, driven to mid-off, the bat-face shut a bit and hence he didn't get power or timing. He was aiming to drive it straight.
dropped by Arnold. Tossed up on the middle stump line, Dravid goes for a sweep. gets  a top-edge and it flies to right of Arnold at short fine leg who moves across, dives but ends up palming it

Gone! Dravid falls and that could be the end of the Indian hopes. He charges down the track and lofts a fullish delivery straight to Murali at long-off. Murali moves to his left and takes it. Pumps his fist in the air and all the Sri Lankan fielders rush towards him.
slipping down the leg side, Harbhajan shapes to pull it and it goes through his legs!
on the off stump line, driven to cover
arm-ball that keeps a touch low. Harbhajan who had shaped to pull, ends up swatting it away to the on side
on the middle stump line, full in length, whipped to midwicket
similar delivery, pushed to the on side
full, on the middle stump line, squirted through point
tossed-up, outside leg stump and driven to long-on
flatter, comes in from outside off, pushed to silly-point

And then there were one. A flighted-up doosra, on the leg and middle stump line, produces a lofted stroke from Zaheer. He wanted to swing it to the cow corner, instead it flies down the throat of Malinga at long-on. Sri Lanka are just a wicket away from the win.
defended carefully back to the bowler
sweep played and missed, rapped on the pad
fullish and on the off, played at and missed, rapped on the pad, shout for lbw, turned down
full and outside the off, it's the doosra, defended away to the off side
tossed up and on the pads, going down leg, padded away
doosra outside the off stump, sits up and asked to be whacked, Munaf obliges
full and on the pads, heaved away to the leg side with one hand
straight and on the stumps, quite full too, defended watchfully
clipped away to the on side for a single to end the over
crack! full and straight, Harbhajan has a go and whacks the ball over midwicket for a boundary. Desperation here at the end
full and outside the off, it's a slower ball. BANG! Harbhajan smashes that for a bix over long-off. That is a good clean hit
flat and on the pads, clipped away down to fine-leg for a single
swept well, one bounce to deep backward square-leg
tossed up and on the stumps, down the track and defended
full and on the off, tossed up a touch, defensive shot played. Off the pads to the off side
flat and on the pads, swept down to the fielder at short fine-leg
flat and on the stumps, defended to the leg side
big offbreak from outside the off stump rips in, Munaf goes back and somehow cuts down to slip
tossed up and on the stumps, big heave, thick inside edge down to the on side
fullish and on the stumps, carefully defended back down the pitch to the bowler
full and flat, on the pads, played at and missed, off the pads to the leg side
slightly short and outside the off, chopped to the off side

That's the end! All over! Munaf heaves this one to the leg side and Chaminda Vaas runs around on the ropes and takes the catch that ends the game! Sri Lanka have won by 69 runs. India are all but knocked out of the World Cup
